description: A broad swath of senior leaders and FBI agents left the agency Friday — marking one of the biggest shakeups in years at the preeminent US law enforcement agency.
title: FBI Mass Exodus Is Latest Shakeup at Trump’s Justice Department

description: Aluminum and steel were among the first tariffs to be enacted during President Donald Trump’s first term. A revival of those measures is expected Saturday, which would affect millions of tons of imported metal.
title: Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Will Impact Millions of Tons of Imports

description: Mexican and Canadian officials worked the phones and booked trips to Washington as time runs out to stave off President Donald Trump’s threat to impose 25% tariffs against the two largest US trading partners on Saturday.
title: Mexico, Canada Work Against the Clock to Avert Trump’s Tariffs

description: Two analysts at Moody’s Ratings — Christopher Collins and Melissa Nicandri — were among the 67 people killed in a midair collision between an American Airlines Group Inc. flight and a military helicopter in Washington on Wednesday night, the credit-grading firm said.
title: Two Moody’s Ratings Analysts Killed in American Air Crash in DC

description: The US Marshals Service will not meet a Friday deadline to tell an influential senator the exact number of Bitcoin assets it controls and how it plans to manage them, according to two people familiar with the matter.
title: US Marshals Won’t Meet Senator’s Deadline to List Cryptoassets

description: Marco Rubio’s choice of Latin America for his first trip abroad as top US diplomat reinforces two of President Donald Trump’s priorities early in his second term — deportations and securing the Panama Canal from perceived Chinese control.
title: Rubio Brings a Tough Message From Trump on Trip to Latin America

description: Top US officials said a military helicopter was on a regular training mission when it collided with a civilian airliner over the Potomac River on Wednesday night. The scenario its pilots were preparing for was anything but routine.
title: Downed Black Hawk Was Practicing Secretive Evacuation Plans

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Disciplined First Week Gives Way to a Rockier Second

description: The sweat was dripping off Friedrich Merz after the frontrunner to become Germany’s next chancellor saw his bid to outflank an ascendant far right spectacularly backfire in the Bundestag.
title: Merz’s Botched Flirtation With Far Right Shakes German Election

description: A coalition of Belgian parties led by a Flemish nationalist reached a deal late Friday on forming a new federal government more than seven months after the country held elections, according to the Belga news agency.
title: Belgian Parties Agree to Install Flemish Nationalist as Premier

description: A judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration from freezing an array of federal grants and loans, undercutting a White House effort to halt the flow of funds already approved by Congress.
title: Trump Spending Freeze Temporarily Blocked by Federal Judge

description: The tech bosses who’ve lined up to pay homage to Donald Trump may have found a common enemy in the European Union, but that won’t save them from legal enforcement on their home ground, according to one of the new president’s key allies.
title: Trump’s Tech Buddies Won’t Escape US Scrutiny, Texas Ally Warns

description: President Donald Trump said he would impose tariffs on a wide range of imports in the coming months, including on steel, aluminum, oil and gas, pharmaceuticals, as well as semiconductors — ramping up his threats to hit trading partners with new levies.
title: Trump Vows Tariffs on Oil, Metals and Chips in Coming Months

description: Donald Trump is trying to blast his way through long-standing legal constraints on presidential power – daring judges to stop him from asserting vast authority over US citizenship, federal spending and the government workforce.
title: Trump Dares Judiciary With Orders Testing His Presidential Power

description: The Pentagon identified two of the three US soldiers killed when their UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter collided with a commercial airliner, but withheld the name of the third at the request of the victim’s family.
title: Pentagon Identifies Two of Three Helicopter Crew Killed in Crash

description: Canada is making a last-minute effort in Washington to convince US President Donald Trump that it’s taking serious measures to improve border security as it tries to avert tariffs.
title: Canada Resorts to Chopper-Video Diplomacy to Halt Trump Tariffs

description: Vice President JD Vance will visit East Palestine, Ohio, on Monday, to mark two years since a train derailment in the town sparked an environmental and public health crisis, according to a person familiar with his plans.
title: JD Vance to Visit East Palestine to Mark Train Derailment Milestone

description: A Russian court ruled major grain trading house Rodnie Polya LLC should come under state control, Kommersant newspaper reported late Friday.
title: Russian Court Rules to Nationalize Top Grain Trader, Report Says

description: Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. awarded restricted stock grants worth hundreds of thousands of dollars to two of President Donald Trump’s appointees.
title: Trump Media Gives Stock Awards to Two of President’s Nominees

description: The US Treasury official who oversees the world’s largest financial infrastructure, including the federal government’s cash-management operations and debt financing, is stepping down from the job.
title: Treasury Official Who Oversees Federal Payments System Is Leaving

description: President Donald Trump intends to move ahead with plans on Saturday to impose 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada and a 10% levy on China, the White House said, denying a report that he planned to delay the implementation by a month.
title: White House Says China, Mexico, Canada Tariffs to Hit Feb. 1

description: Elon Musk’s Tesla Inc. is spearheading an effort to block new tariffs on graphite imports from China, pitting Donald Trump’s richest backer against the president’s favorite economic tool.
title: Brawl Over Tariffs on EV Graphite Will Test Musk’s Sway With Trump

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz suffered a shock setback in his bid to become chancellor after his effort to push through tough migration legislation with backing from the far-right failed in a tense parliamentary vote.
title: German Frontrunner Suffers Blow With Shock Migration Defeat

description: An adviser for US President Donald Trump is set to meet with officials from the government of Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro in Caracas, part of an early effort at engaging with the sanctioned leader of the oil-rich nation.
title: Trump’s Envoy Grenell in Venezuela to Discuss US Prisoners, Gang Members

description: Canada will defer the increase to the capital gains inclusion rate to January 2026 after the measure faced legal challenges and leading politicians disavowed it.
title: Canada Delays Capital Gains Tax Change to 2026 Amid Lawsuits, Political Uncertainty

description: Canada’s national carbon tax on consumer fuels is likely in its final weeks after both major contenders to replace Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as Liberal leader have promised to scrap it.
title: Canada Carbon Tax Appears Dead After Carney Pledges to Scrap It

description: Mexico’s government told Donald Trump that his plan to place 25% tariffs on its goods would be a mistake that raises costs for US consumers, a day after he renewed his pledge to impose them on Saturday.
title: Mexico Warns Trump 25% Tariffs Would Be a ‘Strategic Mistake’

description: AstraZeneca Plc abandoned plans to invest £450 million ($558 million) in a UK vaccine manufacturing plant, following protracted wrangling with the new Labour government over the level of state funding for the site.
title: AstraZeneca Calls Off Vaccine Hub Investment Over UK Funding

description: Chile’s government said that Venezuela ordered its consulates in that country to close citing “the suspension of diplomatic ties,” marking an escalation in hostilities between both South American nations.
title: Chile Says Venezuela Orders Consulates to Close as Spat Worsens

description: President Donald Trump will meet with Nvidia Corp. chief executive Jensen Huang at the White House on Friday, according to people familiar, days after a new Chinese AI model from DeepSeek sparked concern among technology industry leaders and tanked the US stock market.
title: Nvidia CEO Huang to Meet Trump at White House on Friday

description: Videos warn of law-enforcement raids, provide tips to avoid deportation.
title: TikTok Influencers Leverage Power of Gossip to Thwart ICE Raids

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz pressed ahead with tough migration legislation backed by the far right, despite protests that have splintered the country just three weeks before a national election.
title: German Election Front Runner Presses Bill With Far-Right Support

description: Polish police briefly detained former Justice Minister Zbigniew Ziobro on Friday in an attempt to force him to testify before a parliamentary commission investigating the use of Pegasus spyware under the previous government.
title: Polish Police Detain Ex-Justice Chief in Pegasus Spyware Case

description: The memo dropped late on Monday evening after a weeklong flurry of executive orders from President Donald Trump, and was rescinded less than 48 hours later. But the mandate to pause all federal loans and grants has reverberated across the country, from tiny nonprofits to sprawling health agencies.
title: Trump Sparks Lasting Panic With Funding Ban That Ended in Two Days

description: Romanian Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu is racing to find €8 billion ($8.3 billion) in savings as his government struggles to hold its ground against a surge of the far right.
title: Romania Struggles to Trim Budget Without Feeding Far-Right Surge

description: Russia is willing to help with the reconstruction of Syria as it continues to seek a deal with the country’s new leadership to retain two vital military bases, according to a senior Middle East policy adviser to the Russian government.
title: Russia Offers to Help Rebuild Syria as It Bids for Deal on Bases

description: Slovakia ordered the expulsion of a Ukrainian citizen and blocked entry for 10 other foreign nationals as Prime Minister Robert Fico revived an accusation over an alleged attempt by forces abroad to overthrow his government.
title: Slovakia Expels Ukrainian Accused of Plotting to Overthrow Fico

description: The Dutch finance ministry is considering easing parts of the country’s limits on variable pay in a move that could be designed to support banks while seeking to mitigate the risk of a public backlash.
title: Dutch Mull Tweaking Bank Bonus Cap in Political Tightrope Walk

description: French lawmakers on Friday reached a deal on a version of the 2025 budget, paving the way for a showdown in parliament next week that could topple the government.
title: French Conference Committee Reaches Deal on 2025 Budget Bill

description: Turkish lawmakers voted to give President Recep Tayyip Erdogan indirect power to push aside government and private officials, in a move opposition parties see as an attempt to silence critics.
title: Turkey’s Erdogan Tightens Grip on Public and Private Officials

description: Chevron Corp. has begun using “Gulf of America” instead of “Gulf of Mexico” in its earnings materials after President Donald Trump ordered the US to rename it.
title: Chevron Starts Using ‘Gulf of America’ in Nod to Trump

description: Not every country’s financial market is suffering fallout from Donald Trump’s return to the White House — and money managers say relations with the US are playing a growing role in deciding where to invest.
title: BlackRock, Gramercy See New Emerging-Market Winners in Trump Era

description: Bernie Moreno’s childhood dream was to become chairman of General Motors Co. He didn’t make it to the boardroom, but he did get elected to the US Senate, where he’s now aiming to wield influence over the auto industry as the chamber’s self-proclaimed “car czar.”
title: Auto Dealer Turned Senator Becomes Key Figure in Trump’s Anti-EV Crusade

description: Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro is moving ahead with plans to sell a key fertilizer plant in Colombia in a quest to shore up revenue for his country’s ailing economy, squaring him against President Gustavo Petro.
title: Venezuela Pushes Fertilizer Plant Sale in Challenge to Colombia

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz plans to press ahead with a vote Friday on a hard-line immigration bill, waving aside last-ditch efforts aimed at seeking a broader compromise.
title: German Conservatives Press Ahead on Controversial Migration Bill

description: The UK is exploring a slimmed-down version of the European Union’s youth mobility proposal as part of a wider set of discussions seeking closer ties on defense and trade, people familiar with the matter said.
title: UK Eyes Scaled-Down Youth Exchange Pact in Wider EU Negotiations

description: President Vladimir Putin is allowing Goldman Sachs Group Inc. to sell its business in Russia, making the US firm one of the few Western banks to fully exit the country.
title: Putin Allows Goldman Sachs to Sell Its Business in Russia

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Europe’s Splits May Help Putin With Trump Over War in Ukraine

description: Donald Trump’s offensive against diversity, equity and inclusion programs is putting the US central bank in an uncomfortable squeeze. And so far, the Federal Reserve and its chair, Jerome Powell, appear to be falling in line with the president.
title: Powell’s Fed on Defensive as Diversity Effort Comes Under Fire

description: The number of births in Hungary dropped to a record last year, raising questions about the demographic impact of Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s lavish family subsidy program.
title: Hungary Births Drop to Record in Blow to Orban’s Family Policies

description: Germany’s conservative bloc requested a recess in the lower house of parliament on Friday in a sign of the tension over plans to pass a hard-line immigration bill with backing of the far right.
title: German Conservatives Pause Controversial Vote on Migration Bill

description: Nigeria’s power prices need to rise by about two thirds for many customers to reflect the cost of supplying it and an increase can be expected within months, President Bola Tinubu’s special adviser on energy said.
title: Nigeria Needs Much Higher Power Prices, President’s Adviser Says

description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. expressed deep concern over the increasing number of alleged Chinese spies arrested in the Philippines, which has prompted security officials to tighten monitoring.
title: Marcos ‘Very Disturbed’ as More Suspected Chinese Spies Surface

description: Greek lawmakers couldn’t muster enough votes to elect a new president in a second round of voting on Friday.
title: Greek Lawmakers Fail to Elect President in Second Voting Round

description: Empty seats in the Bundestag in Berlin.
title: Follow as Germany’s Parliament Votes on Migration Bill

description: The Philippines’ top diplomat in Washington is optimistic of a White House meeting between President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and Donald Trump in the spring as the former seeks assurances of their alliance in the face of threats from China.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Seeks Reassurances From Trump Over Alliance

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban again threatened to veto European Union sanctions against Russia when they come due for renewal in six months’ time if Ukraine fails to resume the transit of Russian gas by then.
title: Orban Renews Threat to Veto Russia Sanctions Over Gas Transit

description: Myanmar’s military government extended a four-year emergency rule, further delaying plans for long-promised general elections as a civil war rages on.
title: Myanmar Generals Extend Emergency Rule Again, Delaying Polls

description: UK house prices barely rose at the start of the year, according to Nationwide Building Society, suggesting the property market could finally be succumbing to high borrowing costs.
title: UK House Prices Stagnate in January, Nationwide Figures Shows

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday invoked the Hindu goddess of wealth to elevate India’s poor and the middle class, a possible sign the government may introduce measures to lift sagging consumption in the budget due the next day.
title: Ahead of Budget, Modi Asks Wealth Goddess to Bless Middle Class

description: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels are moving “rapidly” through South Kivu province toward the city of Bukavu in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, the United Nations said.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Pressing Toward Bukavu in Congo, UN Says

description: The government needs to be wary about who and what gets bulldozed in its dash for growth.
title: Reeves Can Snub Bats and Newts. But Local Folk? Not So Much.

description: Plan for four luxury flats would sacrifice a century-old elevator as developer seeks to take advantage of approval rush.
title: Historic London Elevator Faces Last Stop in Labour’s Housing Push

description: The nationalist lurch in Slovakia, Austria and Croatia throws into question support for Kyiv just as Donald Trump seeks an end to the war.
title: Putin Is Gaining Allies in Europe at a Bad Time for Ukraine

description: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz is set to take his hard-line immigration push to the next level despite a growing backlash over his move this week to force a resolution through parliament with backing from the far right.
title: German Conservatives to Double Down on Hard-Line Migration Push

description: President Donald Trump’s move to scale back US investments in renewable energy is spurring companies to look to Brazil as an alternative for those projects, according to Finance Minister Fernando Haddad.
title: Trump’s Green Retreat Offers Brazil Opportunity, Minister Says

description: Japan’s economy risks taking another hit if US President Donald Trump slaps fresh tariffs on China, sparking a renewed US-China trade war, according the government’s chief economist.
title: Japan’s Economy Faces Fallout From Trump’s China Tariff Threats

description: Australia’s opposition leader Peter Dutton has echoed US President Donald Trump’s criticism of diversity, equality and inclusion workers in the public sector, the latest center-right leader around the world to flag a potential wind-back of progressive cultural policies.
title: Australia Opposition Chief Echoes Trump on DEI as Election Looms

description: Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said he would ask US President Donald Trump for a stable supply of energy when they meet, hinting at the deals that the Japanese leader may try to strike with Trump in upcoming talks.
title: Ishiba Says Japan Will Seek Stable Energy Supply From Trump

description: President Donald Trump’s inaugural committee received millions of dollars in donations from firms in the cryptocurrency industry that’s already seeing special attention from his administration, disclosures filed with the Senate Office of Public Records show.
title: Trump Raised Millions From Crypto Firms for His Inauguration

description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and his Japanese counterpart agreed during their first phone call to expand their nations’ joint military presence around Japanese islands in the East China Sea, according to Japan’s defense ministry.
title: Hegseth, Japan Defense Minister Agree to Beef Up Military Ties

description: President Donald Trump is poised to unleash his first wave of tariffs Saturday, sending foreign governments and businesses rushing to skirt potential duties and prepare for retaliation.
title: Trump Barrels Toward Tariff Showdown With Canada, Mexico, China
